translations.en:
In the name of Allah, the Most Merciful, the Especially Merciful.

May Allah, the Exalted, send blessings and peace upon our Master Muhammad, his family and his companions.

O Allah! By the rank that Your Prophet, our Master Muhammad (peace be upon him) has with You, by the love You have for him and he has for You, and by the secret between You and him, I ask You to send blessings and peace upon him, his family and his companions.

Increase my love for him many times over. For his sake and his lofty stations, make me truly know him. Grant me success in following his way, living his manners and his sunnah.

Grant me resolve in this. Honor me by allowing me to see the Messenger (peace be upon him). Gladden me by letting me converse with him.

Remove difficulties, barriers, intermediaries and veils. Let my ears partake of his sweet address. Allow me to benefit from the knowledge and gnosis of the Messenger (peace be upon him), O Allah!...

Make my prayers upon him a complete, pure, radiant light that erases every injustice, darkness, doubt, shirk, disbelief, falsehood and sin. Make that salat a cause for my purification.

Through these blessings, raise me to the summit of the station of sincerity, so that no doubt remains in me that any worship is due to any besides You. Thus may I be worthy of Your presence and be joined among Your close friends.

Grant that I do all this while always holding fast to the manners and sunnah of the Messenger (peace be upon him), seeking help from his noble person.

O Allah! O Light! O Truth! O Manifest!

O Allah! O Light! O Truth! O Manifest!

O Allah! O Light! O Truth! O Manifest!
O Allah! Send blessings and peace upon the spirit of our master Muhammad among spirits, his body among bodies, his grave among graves, and upon his family and companions.
O Allah! Every time he is mentioned by those who remember him, send blessings and peace upon our master Muhammad.
O Allah! By the number of those heedless of remembering him, send blessings upon our master Muhammad.

O Allah! Send endless blessings and peace upon the unlettered Prophet, our master Muhammad, upon his wives—the mothers of the believers—his progeny and his noble Household; grant them blessings and peace.

O Allah! By the number encompassed by Your knowledge and stated in the Noble Qur'an, send upon our master Muhammad the blessing that pleases You and befits him. Grant him the station of al-Wasila, virtue and the high rank. O Allah! Cause him to reach the Praiseworthy Station You promised. Reward him as he deserves. Send blessings also upon all his brothers among the prophets, the truthful, the martyrs and the righteous.
O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad, and on the Day of Resurrection place him in the station nearest to You.
O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad.
O Allah! Clothe him with the crown of honor, good pleasure and generosity.

O Allah! Grant our master Muhammad the most excellent of what he asked of You for himself; grant him the most excellent of what any servant has asked of You for him; grant him the most excellent of what will be asked of You for him until the Day of Resurrection.

O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad; upon Adam, Noah, Abraham, Moses and Jesus, and upon all prophets and messengers between them. May Your blessings and peace be upon them all. (Repeated for emphasis.)

O Allah! Send blessings upon our father Adam and our mother Eve equal to the prayers of Your angels. O Allah! Place them in the highest Garden of Firdaws and satisfy them with the most exalted favors by Your mercy and generosity.
O Allah! Reward parents with the most excellent reward You grant on account of their children.

O Allah! Send blessings upon our masters Jibril, Mikail, Israfil, Azrail, the bearers of the Throne, the other angels, the angels of nearness, and upon all the prophets and messengers. May Your blessings and peace be upon them all. (Repeated for emphasis.)
O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad by the number of all that You know, by the weight of all that You know, even by the number of Your words.
O Allah! Send upon our master Muhammad blessings that never diminish.
O Allah! Send upon our master Muhammad blessings that never cease, even if time itself were to end.
O Allah! Send blessings and peace upon our master Muhammad with the very blessings and peace You have sent upon him, and reward him as he deserves.
O Allah! Send upon our master Muhammad blessings that will please him and delight him, through which You will be pleased with us, and reward him as he deserves.

O Allah! Upon our master Muhammad—the sea of lights, the mine of secrets, the one who proclaimed Your oneness, the unique pearl beneath Your sovereignty, the imam of the station of tawhid, the adornment of existence, the treasury of every mercy, the path of Your religion, the one who tastes the sweetness of Your oneness, the essence of humanity, the cause of every existent being, the very essence of creation, the one nearest to the light of Your radiance—send a blessing that endures as long as Your exalted Essence endures, that ceases only when You will, that pleases You and him and by which You become pleased with us. O Allah, Lord of the worlds.
O Allah! Send upon our master Muhammad blessings by the number of what is hidden in Your knowledge and that endure for as long as Your dominion endures.

O Allah! By the number of Your creatures, by Your own good pleasure, by the weight of Your Throne, by the number of Your words; by the number of times Your creatures have remembered You and will remember You; every year, month, Friday, day, night, hour, scent, breath, blink of an eye, movement of an eye—by multiples of these to the infinity of infinity, through the endlessness of this world and the Hereafter—send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household, and bless them, just as You sent blessings and bestowed grace upon the household of our master Abraham. Truly, You are Praiseworthy, Glorious.
O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad according to the measure of Your love for him.
O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad according to the measure of Your grace and generosity to him.
O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad in a way befitting Your rank with him and his worth with You.

O Allah! Send such blessings upon our master Muhammad that by them You save us from all calamities and fears, fulfill all our needs, cleanse us of all sins, raise us to the highest degrees, and bring us to the furthest reaches of good in this world and after death.
O Allah! Send upon our master Muhammad the blessings that please You, and be completely pleased with his companions.

O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad, his family and companions—by the number of all who have passed among Your creation until now, the fortunate and the wretched alike—with a blessing that gathers every number, has no limits or end, does not cease, and endures eternally with Your Essence. And send perfect peace upon them.

O Allah! Upon our master Muhammad, whose heart You filled with majesty and whose eye You filled with beauty, whom You gladdened with support and aid—send blessings upon him, his family and companions, and send perfect peace upon them. Praise belongs to Allah alone.
O Allah! Send blessings upon our master and heart’s sovereign Muhammad by the number of olive leaves and the leaves of all fruits.

O Allah! Send blessings upon our master and heart’s sovereign Muhammad by the number of all that has been and will be, by the number of living and non-living things that night darkens and day illuminates.
O Allah! Send blessings upon our master and heart’s sovereign Muhammad, upon his family, his wives, and his progeny, by the number of his ummah.

O Allah! By the blessings we recite upon our master—peace and blessings be upon him—make us, in this world and the Hereafter, among those saved through these prayers; among those who reach his Kawthar basin and drink from it; among those who obey him and act by his Sunnah. O Allah, Lord of the worlds, do not place a veil between him and us on the Day of Resurrection. Forgive us, our parents and all Muslims. Praise belongs to Allah, Lord of the worlds. (Beginning of the second third)

O Allah! Send successive, light-filled blessings and peace upon our master Muhammad and his household—the most virtuous and exalted of the prophets and messengers, the best of creation, the lamp of the horizons through whom prophets, messengers, angels and saints reach You.

O Allah! Send blessings, peace and blessing upon our master Muhammad—praised in Your verse, the most honored caller who clings to the rope of Your law, the seal of the prophets and messengers—and upon his household, with a blessing that will bring us in this world and the Hereafter to his all-encompassing grace and to Your generous favor with which You are pleased.

O Allah! Send inexhaustible, ever-increasing blessings and peace upon our master Muhammad and his household—the most generous of the noble, the most honored caller to the paths of guidance, the lamp of every land—and by them grant us manifold gifts and bounties.
O Allah! Send upon our master Muhammad and his household blessings and peace that never cease, indeed that cannot be numbered, and honor them.

O Allah! In all realms, as You sent blessings upon our master Abraham and his household, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household. Truly, You are Praiseworthy, Glorious. O Allah! At every remembrance by those who remember him and at every lapse by those heedless of his name, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! As You sent blessings, mercy and blessing upon our master Abraham and his household, send blessings, mercy and blessing upon our master Muhammad and his household. Truly, You are Praiseworthy, Glorious.
O Allah! Send blessings and peace upon our master Muhammad—the pure and purified unlettered Prophet—and upon his household.
O Allah! Send peace upon the one with whom prophethood was sealed, whom You strengthened by granting the Kawthar basin and the right of intercession.

O Allah! Send blessings upon the Prophet of judgment and wisdom, the brightest lamp, the one endowed with the greatest character, the owner of the Mi'raj—the Seal of the Prophets—our master Muhammad; and upon his household, his companions, and the followers who walk his straight path.

O Allah! Make the paths of the stars of Islam—their guides in dark and fearful nights—mighty through our master. Send unceasing blessings upon our master and heart’s sovereign Muhammad, upon his family, companions and followers, for as long as waves surge in the sea and pilgrims circumambulate the Kaaba from distant lands.

May the most excellent of prayers and salutations be upon the noble Messenger of Allah—chosen among servants, intercessor of creation in the Hereafter, owner of the Praiseworthy Station and the Kawthar basin, bearer of the burden of the message and universal conveyance, honored with striving for religion and worldly affairs—our master Muhammad.
May Allah Most High send upon him and his household blessings that continue day and night.
Our master Muhammad—may Allah’s peace and blessings be upon him—is the leader and most virtuous of all who were created before him and all who will be created after him.
Our master Muhammad—may Allah’s peace and blessings be upon him—is the leader and most virtuous of all who were created before him and all who will be created after him.

In the name of Allah, the Most Merciful, the Especially Merciful.

May Allah, the Exalted, send blessings and peace upon our Master Muhammad, his family and his companions.

O Allah! By the rank that Your Prophet, our Master Muhammad (peace be upon him) has with You, by the love You have for him and he has for You, and by the secret between You and him, I ask You to send blessings and peace upon him, his family and his companions.

Increase my love for him many times over. For his sake and his lofty stations, make me truly know him. Grant me success in following his way, living his manners and his sunnah.

Grant me resolve in this. Honor me by allowing me to see the Messenger (peace be upon him). Gladden me by letting me converse with him.

Remove difficulties, barriers, intermediaries and veils. Let my ears partake of his sweet address. Allow me to benefit from the knowledge and gnosis of the Messenger (peace be upon him), O Allah!...

Make my prayers upon him a complete, pure, radiant light that erases every injustice, darkness, doubt, shirk, disbelief, falsehood and sin. Make that salat a cause for my purification.

Through these blessings, raise me to the summit of the station of sincerity, so that no doubt remains in me that any worship is due to any besides You. Thus may I be worthy of Your presence and be joined among Your close friends.

Grant that I do all this while always holding fast to the manners and sunnah of the Messenger (peace be upon him), seeking help from his noble person.

O Allah! O Light! O Truth! O Manifest!

O Allah! O Light! O Truth! O Manifest!

O Allah! O Light! O Truth! O Manifest!
O Allah! Send blessings upon Your servant, Your Messenger, the unlettered Prophet—our master Muhammad—and upon his household.

O Allah! Send upon our master Muhammad and his household the blessing that secures Your good pleasure as a reward for him. Grant him the station of al-Wasila, the Praiseworthy Station You promised, and virtue. Reward him on our behalf with the best reward You have granted any prophet on behalf of his people and any messenger on behalf of his ummah, according to what he deserves. O Most Merciful of the merciful! Send blessings also upon all his brothers among the prophets and the righteous.

O Allah! Bestow upon our master Muhammad—leader of good, opener of blessing, Prophet of mercy and master of this ummah, the Messenger of Allah, Lord of the worlds, and master of the messengers—the most virtuous of Your prayers, the noblest of ever-increasing benefits, the greatest of blessings, the acts of kindness that flow from Your mercy, compassion and generosity, and the most excellent of favors.
O Allah! Bring him to the Praiseworthy Station that the first and the last will envy, a station that will please him and increase his nearness to You.
O Allah! Grant our master Muhammad the bounty, the virtue, the honor, the station of al-Wasila which is the highest place in Paradise, and the loftiest of degrees and stations.
O Allah! Grant our master Muhammad the station of al-Wasila, fulfill his hopes, and make him the first to intercede and the first whose intercession is accepted.

O Allah! Magnify the proofs that point to his prophethood. Make his scale heavy. Make his proof radiant. Raise his rank among the people of the lofty stations where the near angels, the prophets, martyrs, saints and scholars gather in the seventh heaven. Elevate his station above even the station of the near ones.

O Allah! Give us life by his Sunnah. Cause us to die living upon his religion. Make us among those who attain his intercession. Gather us in his community. Bring us to the Kawthar basin. Let us drink from its cups without our faults being exposed. Without regret, without doubt, without any change or trial for or against us, give us to drink the Kawthar drink with its cups. O Allah, Lord of the worlds.

O Allah! Grant our master Muhammad and his household the station of al-Wasila, virtue and the high rank. Bring him, together with his brothers among the prophets, to the Praiseworthy Station You promised him. O Allah! Upon the master of this ummah and Prophet of mercy—our master Muhammad—upon our father Adam, our mother Eve, and upon the prophets, the truthful, the martyrs and the righteous who came from them; upon all the angels of earth and sky; and upon us together—send blessings. O Most Merciful of the merciful!

O Allah! Forgive me, my sins, and my parents. O Allah! Show mercy to my parents as they raised me when I was small. Forgive all male and female believers, all male and female Muslims, their dead and their living. Aid us in showing care for one another, avoiding enmity, and praying for each other. My Lord, forgive me and have mercy on me; You are the best of the merciful. Power and might belong only to Allah, the Most High, the Most Great.

O Allah! Upon the light of lights, the secret of secrets, the master of the most truthful and best servants in the station of the righteous; the adornment of noble messengers; the most generous of those upon whom night casts its darkness and day sheds its light—our master Muhammad—send blessings by the number of raindrops that have fallen from the first moment of the world to its last, by the number of plants and all that grows on trees, blessings that endure as long as the dominion of the One, the Subduer endures.

O Allah! Upon our master Muhammad in this world—his Pure Garden—and in the Hereafter—his abode in the Highest Firdaws—send blessings that will ennoble and magnify his station, and on the Day of Resurrection grant him what he desires and will be pleased with.

O our master Muhammad! This prayer is to honor your right which is obligatory upon us. O our master Muhammad! This prayer is to honor your right which is obligatory upon us. O our master Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him)! This prayer is to honor your right which is obligatory upon us.

O Allah! Upon the one indicated by the letters Ha (mercy), two Mims (sovereignty), and Dal (refuge of all creation)—M-u-Ha-m-M-e-D—lordly master possessing every virtue, perfect, whose light was the first created, a mercy to the worlds and seal of prophethood—our master Muhammad—send blessings as numerous as those in Your knowledge, for as long as those who remember You and him remember, and those heedless of Your and his remembrance are heedless, and for as long as Your exalted Essence endures eternally. Such blessings will end only if You judge them sufficient. Truly, You are Powerful over all things.

O Allah! Upon the most beautiful and most luminous of the suns of guidance—the unlettered Prophet, our master Muhammad—and upon his household, send blessings. For our master Muhammad (peace be upon him) is the most renowned and most praiseworthy among the prophets regarding the news of his prophethood; his light is brighter, more honored and clearer than all prophets; in character he is the purest and most immaculate of them; in his created form he is the most noble and soundest of them.

O Allah! Upon our master, the unlettered Prophet Muhammad, whose beauty surpasses the full moon and whose generosity exceeds rain clouds and the waters of the oceans—and upon his household—send blessings.

O Allah! Upon our master, the unlettered Prophet Muhammad—whose very essence and life are the embodiment of blessing, whose remembrance and fragrance delight every created being—and upon his household, send blessings.
O Allah! Send blessings and peace upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! As You sent blessings, mercy and blessing upon our master Abraham and his household, send blessings, mercy and blessing upon our master Muhammad and his household. Truly, You are Praiseworthy, Glorious.
O Allah! Send blessings upon Your servant, Your Prophet, Your Messenger, the unlettered Prophet—our master Muhammad—and upon his household.

O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household to the fullness of this world and the Hereafter. Bestow blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household to the fullness of this world and the Hereafter. Bestow mercy upon our master Muhammad and his household to the fullness of this world and the Hereafter. Send peace upon our master Muhammad and his household to the fullness of this world and the Hereafter.
O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad in the way You commanded us to send them; send blessings upon our master Muhammad in the manner most fitting for sending them.

O Allah! Send prayers upon Your Prophet chosen from among all prophets, Your Messenger with whom You are pleased from among all servants, Your friend chosen from the noblest of creation from Adam (peace be upon him) until he was brought to the realm of existence, the trustworthy one regarding heavenly revelation—our master Muhammad.

O Allah! Upon our master Muhammad—whom You brought forth from the pure loins of the most noble forefathers and the pure wombs of the most honorable mothers, from the line of Abd Manaf son of Abd al-Muttalib; by whom You guided those who opposed Islam and opened the way of chastity; whom You chose from that noble lineage—send blessings.

O Allah! By the most excellent of what is asked of You, by the most beloved and honored of Your names, by the blessings You granted us through our Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), by how through him You protected us from misguidance, and by the fact that You commanded us to send blessings upon him— which You accept as a station for us in this world and the Hereafter, and as a grace from You forgiving our sins—by honoring Your command and believing with all our hearts that You fulfill what You promise, we implore You. O our Lord! When we believed in him and affirmed him at the Covenant of Alast, when we followed the Qur’an You sent down to him—remembering Your words: “Indeed Allah and His angels send blessings upon the Prophet. O you who believe, send blessings upon him and greet him with peace”—You made sending blessings upon him obligatory for Your servants. You commanded them to do so. O our Lord! By the sanctity of Your exalted Essence, by the light of Your majesty and what You have made obligatory upon those of the station of bestowal, we ask You to send upon Your servant, Your Messenger, Your Prophet, the best of Your creation, the noble master Muhammad—the most excellent of all the prayers You send upon any of Your creation—with Your blessings and the blessings of all Your angels. Truly, You are Praiseworthy, Glorious.

O Allah! Raise the rank of our master Muhammad. Exalt his station. Make his scale heavy on the Day of Resurrection. Make his proof radiant, his religion always manifest, his reward abundant, his light shining. Keep his honor enduring in both worlds. And join with him his progeny and noble Household who gladden his eye. Make him great among the prophets who preceded him.

O Allah! Make our master Muhammad, in terms of those who follow him, the prophet with the largest ummah and viziers, his light and rank superior to all prophets, his degree the highest of the prophets, and his station in Paradise the widest and most expansive.
O Allah! Make him among the foremost; his rank among those singled out; his station among those chosen from the pure servants; his place among those near to You in the station of the mukarabbun.

O Allah! Make our master Muhammad, in Your presence, of the most generous in rank, greatest in reward, closest in assembly to You, most firmly established in station, truest in speech, best in request granted, and most coveted among those near You. Lodge him where there is no rank above his, in the Firdaws palaces of the highest Gardens.

O Allah! Make our master Muhammad the most truthful in speech, the one whose request is most swiftly answered, the first to intercede—and whose intercession is accepted—so that when You choose to separate Your servants into the people of Paradise and the people of Hell, he will be the most truthful among those who speak, the most certain among those guided on the path, and the best of the doers of good among the prophets.
O Allah! Make our Prophet the pioneer who prepares means for his ummah after him, and make his Kawthar basin the meeting place for those of us who arrive early and late.
O Allah! Gather us in his community. Grant us to act by his Sunnah. Cause us to die upon his religion. Show us his radiant noble face. Include us among his community and followers.

O Allah! We believed in him without seeing him; reunite us with him. Until You bring us to his Kawthar basin and admit us wherever he enters, do not separate between us. Make us among those favored with Your blessings: the prophets, the truthful, the martyrs, and his righteous companions. What excellent companions they are. Praise belongs to Allah, Lord of the worlds.

O Allah! Our master Muhammad (peace be upon him) is the light of guidance, the caller to good, the inviter to the happiness of both worlds, the Prophet of mercy, the Imam of the pious, after whom no prophet will come—the Messenger of Allah, Lord of the worlds. Our master Muhammad (peace be upon him) conveyed his message, counseled his servants, recited to them Your verses, established the prescribed penalties as legal measures for those who commit prohibitions, executed Your rulings, commanded obedience to You, forbade disobedience to You, allied with those You command be befriended, and opposed those You command be opposed. So send blessings upon our master Muhammad.

O Allah! Upon the body of our master Muhammad among bodies, his spirit among spirits, his resting place among resting places, his blessed grave among graves, his remembrance when he is mentioned—send blessings upon our Prophet Muhammad.
O Allah! Convey from us to him the greetings of peace, mercy and blessings, as befits Your exalted Essence.

O Allah! Upon the angels of nearness, upon Your prophets purified of all faults, upon the messengers sent with Your divine books, upon the bearers of the Throne, upon our masters Jibril, Mikail, Israfil, Azrail; upon Ridwan the gatekeeper of Paradise and Malik the gatekeeper of Hell; upon the noble recording angels to the right and left who record good and evil; upon all in heaven and earth who obey You—send blessings.

O Allah! Whatever You granted to any of the families of the messengers, grant even greater to the Household of Your Prophet. And whatever reward You gave to any companion of the messengers, reward the companions of our Prophet with something even more excellent.

O Allah! Forgive the believing men and women, the Muslim men and women, their dead and their living. “Our Lord, forgive us and our brethren who preceded us in faith, and place not in our hearts any rancor toward those who have believed. Our Lord, indeed You are Kind, Merciful.”
O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad the Prophet, from the Hashimite line, and upon his family and companions. Send perfect peace upon them.
O Most Merciful of the merciful! With the blessing that pleases You and pleases him, and by which You will be pleased with us, send blessings upon the best of humanity—our master Muhammad.

O Allah! Upon our master Muhammad, his family and his companions, send abundant, beautiful, complete blessings and peace, rich with fragrance and blessings, that will endure as long as Allah’s dominion endures.

O Allah! Upon our master Muhammad and his household send blessings equal to the expanse of the cosmos, by the number of the stars in the sky, by the measure of all You have created until now and will create until the Day of Resurrection—send that blessing which maintains the balance of heaven and earth.

O Allah! As You sent blessings upon our master Abraham, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household. As You bestowed blessings upon our master Abraham and his household among all beings, bestow blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household. Truly, You are Praiseworthy, Glorious.
O Allah! In my religion, worldly affairs and Hereafter I seek forgiveness from all sins, and safety from trials and sorrows.

O Allah! Cover our sins, faults and disobedience with Your exalted generosity. O Allah! Cover our sins, faults and disobedience with Your exalted generosity. O Allah! Cover our sins, faults and disobedience with Your exalted generosity.

O Allah! By Your supreme truth and the light of Your Beauty; by Your mighty Throne, by Your grandeur, majesty, beauty, power and strength; by the right of the Footstool bearing Your Throne; by the names in the treasures of secrets that none of creation knows—I ask You, O my Lord.

O Allah! By the name which, when placed upon the night, darkens it; when placed upon the day, brightens it; when placed upon the sky, holds it without pillars; when placed upon the earth, makes it firm; when placed upon the mountains, fixes them; when inscribed upon the seas and valleys, makes the waters surge and flow and fountains gush forth; and when placed upon the clouds, brings down rain—I ask You, O my Lord.

O Allah! By the names written on the forehead of our master Israfil (peace be upon him) and on the forehead of our master Jibril (peace be upon him), and by the names written upon the angels of the station of nearness, I ask You.
O Allah! By the names written around the Throne and written around the Footstool, I ask You.
O Allah! By the Supreme Name written upon the olive leaf, I ask You.
O Allah! By the exalted names with which You named Your Essence—those I know and those I do not know—I ask You.

In the name of Allah, the Most Merciful, the Especially Merciful.

May Allah, the Exalted, send blessings and peace upon our Master Muhammad, his family and his companions.

O Allah! By the rank that Your Prophet, our Master Muhammad (peace be upon him) has with You, by the love You have for him and he has for You, and by the secret between You and him, I ask You to send blessings and peace upon him, his family and his companions.

Increase my love for him many times over. For his sake and his lofty stations, make me truly know him. Grant me success in following his way, living his manners and his sunnah.

Grant me resolve in this. Honor me by allowing me to see the Messenger (peace be upon him). Gladden me by letting me converse with him.

Remove difficulties, barriers, intermediaries and veils. Let my ears partake of his sweet address. Allow me to benefit from the knowledge and gnosis of the Messenger (peace be upon him), O Allah!...

Make my prayers upon him a complete, pure, radiant light that erases every injustice, darkness, doubt, shirk, disbelief, falsehood and sin. Make that salat a cause for my purification.

Through these blessings, raise me to the summit of the station of sincerity, so that no doubt remains in me that any worship is due to any besides You. Thus may I be worthy of Your presence and be joined among Your close friends.

Grant that I do all this while always holding fast to the manners and sunnah of the Messenger (peace be upon him), seeking help from his noble person.

O Allah! O Light! O Truth! O Manifest!

O Allah! O Light! O Truth! O Manifest!

O Allah! O Light! O Truth! O Manifest!

O Allah! By the names with which our master Adam (peace be upon him) called upon You, I present my plea. By the names with which our master Noah called upon You; our master Hud; our master Abraham; our master Salih; our master Yunus; our master Ayyub; our master Jacob; our master Joseph—(peace be upon them all)—I ask You.

By the names with which our master Moses called upon You; our master Aaron; our master Shu'ayb; our master Ishmael; our master David; our master Solomon; our master Zachariah; our master John; our master Jeremiah—(peace be upon them all)—I ask You.

By the names with which our master Shaya (peace be upon him) called upon You; our master Elias; our master Elisha; our master Dhu'l-Kifl; our master Joshua; our master Jesus; and by the names with which our master Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him, and upon all prophets and messengers) called upon You—O Allah, Lord of the worlds!—by the prophets and messengers I have mentioned, and by the names they used in their supplications to You, I ask You.

Before the sky was set, the earth spread, the mountains fixed, the seas roared, the springs gushed, the rivers flowed, the sun rose, the moon shone, and the stars sparkled—by the number of what You created—I ask You to send prayers upon Your Prophet, our master Muhammad. For You are as You are; none knows Your state but You. You are One without partner.

O Allah! By the number of Your forbearance, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. By the number of Your knowledge, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. By the number of Your inexhaustible words, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. By the number of Your favors, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. By the fullness of the heavens, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. By the fullness of the earth, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. By the fullness of Your Throne, and by its weight, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. By the number of what the Pen wrote in the Preserved Tablet of all that was and will be, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. By the number of what You created in the seven heavens, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. Each day until the Day of Resurrection, send a thousand blessings upon our master Muhammad.
O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of raindrops falling from sky to earth, send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad.

O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of those who glorify You with Subhanallah, proclaim Your oneness with La ilaha illa Allah, declare Your greatness, and magnify You with “Glory be to my Lord the Magnificent,” send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad.

O Allah! By the number of their breaths and utterances, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of every living soul You created among them, send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad.

O Allah! Upon our master Muhammad, by the number of moving clouds, send blessings. By the number of blowing winds, from the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, send a thousand blessings each day.

O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of all You created between earth and sky—and by the number of branches, leaves, trees and fruits moved by the wind—send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad.
O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of stars in the sky, send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad.
O Allah! By the amount borne by the earth of things that point to Your power and might, send blessings upon our master Muhammad.

O Allah! By the number of creatures You created in the seven seas—whose count only Your exalted Essence knows—and by what You will create until the Day of Resurrection, send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad.
O Allah! By the fullness of the seven seas, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. By the weight of what these seven seas carry that point to Your power, send blessings.
O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of the waves of the seas, send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad.

O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of grains of sand and pebbles in the depths, plains and mountains of the earth, send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad.

O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of waves of fresh and salty waters as they move and surge—by the number of every pebble, small stone and dry clod upon and within the earth, in the east and west, in plains, mountains and valleys, in every place built up or left in ruins—by that number, send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad.

O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of trees, fruits, leaves, crops and all blessed plants that emerge in the east, west, toward the qibla, in the plains, mountains and valleys of the earth, send a thousand blessings each day upon our Prophet Muhammad.

O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of the jinn, humans and devils You have created and will create, send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad.
O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of hairs on their bodies, faces and heads, send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad.
O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, as long as birds beat their wings and jinn and devils fly, send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad.

O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of humans and jinn—large and small—created on two or four legs in the east and west of the earth whose number only Your exalted Essence knows, send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad.
O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of their footsteps upon the earth, send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad.

O Allah! By the number of those who send blessings upon him, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. By the number of those who do not send blessings upon him, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. By the number of plants that grow and raindrops that fall, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. By the number of every existent thing, send blessings upon our master Muhammad.

O Allah! Upon our master Muhammad when night darkens and when day brightens, send blessings. In this world and the Hereafter, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. When he was a pure young man, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. In his maturity that pleased You, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. From the moment he was a child in the cradle, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. Send blessings upon him until nothing remains of the blessings that should be sent.
O Allah! Grant our master Muhammad the Praiseworthy Station You promised—the one You affirmed for him whenever he requested and whenever You granted all he asked.
O Allah! Make the path of our master Muhammad exalted, his proof noble, the evidences of his prophethood manifest, and his virtue clear to all creation.

O Allah! Accept his greatest intercession for his ummah. Grant us to act by his Sunnah. Cause us to live and die upon his religion. Gather us in his community and under his banner. Include us among his companions. Bring us to his Kawthar basin. Give us to drink from its cups of the Kawthar drink. Grant us the blessing of his love. (Here the reciter should mention their own name and their father’s name, e.g., “Ali son of Ahmed” or “Fatima daughter of Ahmed.”)

O Allah! By the names I have invoked and by the number of things known only to Your exalted Essence, I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad, to have mercy on me, accept my repentance, rescue me from all material and spiritual afflictions, grant me well-being, and have mercy on all believing men and women, all Muslim men and women, their dead and their living. Accept the repentance of this weak, sinful servant and forgive him. O Allah, Lord of the worlds! Amin.

Our Prophet (peace be upon him) said: “Whoever recites this prayer once, Allah grants him the reward of an accepted Hajj and of freeing a slave from the descendants of Ishmael (peace be upon him).” And Allah says: “O My angels! This is a servant who has sent many blessings upon My beloved Muhammad (peace be upon him). By My might, My majesty, My existence, My worthiness of praise and My exaltedness, I will grant him, for every letter of his prayer, a palace in Paradise. His face will shine like the full moon on the fourteenth night. On the Day of Resurrection he will come under the Banner of Praise, and his hand will be in the hand of My beloved Muhammad (peace be upon him).” This virtue applies to whoever recites this prayer on Friday. Allah is the Possessor of great bounty.

O Allah! By Your might, power, majesty, honor and sovereignty; by what the Footstool bears; by the hidden Supreme Name with which You named Your Essence and placed within the Noble Qur'an, reserved for the unseen knowledge with You—I ask that You send blessings upon Your servant and messenger, our master Muhammad. O Allah! By the name with which, when You are called upon, You answer, and when You are asked, You give, I ask You.

O Allah! By Your name which, when placed upon the night, darkens it; when placed upon the day, brightens it; which holds up the sky without pillars; steadies the earth; fixes the mountains; subdues the strong and the tyrant; pours down water from the sky; and when placed upon the clouds, brings down rain—I ask You.

O Allah! By the name with which our Prophet Muhammad made supplication to You; by the name with which our Prophet Adam made supplication to You; by the names with which all prophets, messengers, and the angels of nearness—upon all of whom be Your prayers and peace—and all the people of obedience made supplication to You, I ask You.

Before the sky was built, the earth spread, the mountains fixed, the springs burst forth, the rivers flowed, the sun rose, the moon shone, and the stars glittered—by the number of what You created—I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household by the number of what Your knowledge relates to; by the number relating to Your pardon; by the number of Your forbearance. By the number contained in the portion of the Preserved Tablet that pertains to Your exalted knowledge, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household by the number of the judgments written by the Pen in the Preserved Tablet—untouched by Satan or jinn and never altered—of all that was and will be. Send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household by the fullness of the earth. Send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household by the fullness of the heavens. Send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household by the number of what You will create from the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection.

O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of the ranks of angels, their glorifications, sanctifications, praises, magnifications and proclamations of Your oneness, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.
O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of moving clouds and the ranks of blowing winds, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! By the number of raindrops that have fallen from Your heavens to the earth until now and that will fall until the Day of Resurrection, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the amount of wind that blows, by the number of movements of trees, leaves and crops, and by the number of seeds You created in their special protectives—by all seeds—send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.
O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of raindrops and plants, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.
O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of stars in the sky, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! By the number of creatures You created in the seven seas—known only to You—and by what You will create until the Day of Resurrection, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.
O Allah! By the number of pebbles and grains of sand in the east and west of the earth, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.
O Allah! By the number of jinn and humans You have created until now and will create until the Day of Resurrection, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of breaths, words and the moments of a blink among humans and jinn, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.
O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of flights of jinn and angels, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! By the number of birds in the east and west, of wild animals, and of even the small creatures that live on human, animal and insect bodies, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.
O Allah! By the number of the living and the dead, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.
O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of things night darkens and day illuminates, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.
O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of living creatures that walk on two or four legs, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.
O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of jinn, humans and angels who send blessings upon our master Muhammad, send blessings upon him.
O Allah! By the number of those who do not send blessings upon our master Muhammad, send blessings upon him.
O Allah! Upon our master Muhammad and his household, send the blessings that are due to be sent upon him.
O Allah! Upon our master Muhammad and his household, send the blessings that befit his rank.
O Allah! Upon our master Muhammad and his household, send all the blessings such that none of the blessings due to him remain unsent.

O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad among the prophets and all believers; among the believers, the truthful, the martyrs and the righteous who came after his departure to the Hereafter; and upon him in the Highest Assembly—the station of the most exalted angels—until the Day of Resurrection. Allah’s will is done; there is no power or strength except with Allah, the Most High, the Most Great.

In the name of Allah, the Most Merciful, the Especially Merciful.

May Allah, the Exalted, send blessings and peace upon our Master Muhammad, his family and his companions.

O Allah! By the rank that Your Prophet, our Master Muhammad (peace be upon him) has with You, by the love You have for him and he has for You, and by the secret between You and him, I ask You to send blessings and peace upon him, his family and his companions.

Increase my love for him many times over. For his sake and his lofty stations, make me truly know him. Grant me success in following his way, living his manners and his sunnah.

Grant me resolve in this. Honor me by allowing me to see the Messenger (peace be upon him). Gladden me by letting me converse with him.

Remove difficulties, barriers, intermediaries and veils. Let my ears partake of his sweet address. Allow me to benefit from the knowledge and gnosis of the Messenger (peace be upon him), O Allah!...

Make my prayers upon him a complete, pure, radiant light that erases every injustice, darkness, doubt, shirk, disbelief, falsehood and sin. Make that salat a cause for my purification.

Through these blessings, raise me to the summit of the station of sincerity, so that no doubt remains in me that any worship is due to any besides You. Thus may I be worthy of Your presence and be joined among Your close friends.

Grant that I do all this while always holding fast to the manners and sunnah of the Messenger (peace be upon him), seeking help from his noble person.

O Allah! O Light! O Truth! O Manifest!

O Allah! O Light! O Truth! O Manifest!

O Allah! O Light! O Truth! O Manifest!

O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household. Grant our master Muhammad the station of al-Wasila, the lofty rank and virtue, and cause him to reach the Praiseworthy Station You promised. Truly, You do not break Your promise.

O Lord of the mighty Throne, O Allah, Lord of all realms! Exalt the honor of our master Muhammad, make his religion manifest, and illuminate the proofs that point to his prophethood. Bring forth his virtue, accept his intercession for his ummah, and grant us to act by his Sunnah.
Gather us beneath his banner together with his community. Give us to drink from his cup of the Kawthar drink. Let us benefit from his love. O Allah, Lord of the worlds.
O our Lord, convey to him from us the most excellent greeting of peace. Bestow Your favor upon him on behalf of his ummah.

O Allah, O our Lord! I ask You to forgive me, have mercy on me, accept my repentance, and grant me well-being from every calamity descending from the sky or emerging from the earth. By Your mercy You are powerful over all things. O our Lord! For the sake of Your mercy I ask that You pardon all male and female believers, all male and female Muslims, and their dead and their living. May Allah Most High be pleased with the pure mothers of the believers, the wives of our Prophet, with the lamps of this world—the guiding imams who are learned guides—his Companions, and the Tabi'un who followed after them, and those who follow them with excellence until the Day of Resurrection. Praise belongs to Allah, Lord of the worlds. (Beginning of the third third)

O Lord of spirits and of decayed bodies! I ask You by the obedience of the spirits returning to their bodies and the obedience of the bodies joined to their veins. All creatures stand before You hoping for Your mercy, fearing Your punishment, awaiting Your judgment. By Your words that apply to every spirit and body, and by the right You take from them, I ask You to grant me light in my sight to perceive the truth, remembrance on my tongue by night and day, and righteous deeds. Provide me with these, O my Lord!
O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad as You sent blessings upon our master Abraham, and bless him as You blessed him.

O Allah! As You sent blessings and grace upon our master Abraham and his household, send blessings and grace upon our master Muhammad and his household. Indeed, You are Praiseworthy, Glorious. O Allah! As You blessed the household of our master Abraham, bless the household of our master Muhammad. Indeed, You are Praiseworthy, Glorious.
O Allah! Send blessings upon Your servant and Messenger, our master Muhammad, and upon all male and female believers and all male and female Muslims.

O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household by the number encompassed by Your knowledge, by the measure set by Your Book, and witnessed by Your angels, with a blessing that endures as long as Your kingdom endures.

O Allah! By the lofty names I know and those I do not know, and by the names with which You named Your Essence, I ask that You send blessings upon Your servant, Your Prophet, our master Muhammad, by the number that only You know, before the sky was built, the earth spread, the mountains fixed, the springs gushed, the rivers flowed, the sun rose, the moon shone, the stars sparkled, the seas surged, and the trees bore fruit.

O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad by the number of Your knowledge. O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad by the number of Your forbearance. O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad by the number of Your inexhaustible words. O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad by the number of Your favors. O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad according to Your bounty. O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad by the number of Your generosity. O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad by the number of the heavens, and by the measure of the earth. O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad by the number of the angels You created in the seven heavens; by the number of the jinn, humans, beasts, birds and other creatures You created on earth. O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad by the number of what the Pen has written in the Preserved Tablet of decree and what it will write until the Day of Resurrection, and by the number of raindrops. O Allah! By the number of those who praise and thank You, who declare Your oneness with “La ilaha illa Allah,” who magnify You saying “Indeed, You are Praiseworthy, Glorious,” and who bear witness that You are Allah, send blessings upon our master Muhammad. O Allah! Send blessings upon him by the number of Your prayers upon him and the prayers of Your angels; by the number of those among Your creation who send blessings upon him; by the number of those who do not send blessings upon him; by the number of mountains, sands and pebbles; by the number of trees and their leaves and dried clay and all weights; by the number of what You create in every year and what perishes in it; by the number of what You create each day and what dies in it until the Day of Resurrection.

O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad by the measure of the water that the moving clouds pour down between heaven and earth; by the number of winds driven across the horizons of heaven and earth—east, west, toward the qibla and in their depths; by the number of the stars of the sky; by the number of fish, living creatures, waters, sands and all other beings You created in the seas; by the number of plants and pebbles; by the number of ants; by the amount of fresh and salty waters; by the number of blessings You have bestowed upon all creation; and by the measure of the punishment and chastisement You gave to those who denied You. O Allah! Send blessings upon him for as long as this world and the Hereafter endure; for as long as Paradise endures and as long as Hell endures. O Allah! Send blessings upon him as much as You love and are pleased with him; and as long as he loves You and is pleased with You. O Allah! Send blessings upon him forever without end. Lodge him in the nearest station to You. Grant him in Paradise the station of al-Wasila, virtue, intercession, high rank, and the Praiseworthy Station You promised. Indeed, You do not break Your promise.

O Allah! Truly You are my Owner and Master in the matters of my worldly life and my Hereafter, my refuge in every state, my assurance, the One to whom I entrust all my affairs, the One in whom alone I place my hopes and present my needs and desires. By the sanctity of the Sacred Month, the Sacred City, the Sacred Monument and the noble grave of our Prophet (peace be upon him), I ask You to grant me of good what only Your exalted Essence knows, and to protect me from evil in a measure known only to Your exalted Essence.

O Allah! You forgave our master Adam; You granted our master Seth; You gave our master Abraham his sons Ishmael and Isaac; You reunited our master Joseph with our master Jacob; You returned our master Moses to his mother; You increased our master Khidr in knowledge; You granted our master David his son our master Solomon; You bestowed upon our master Zachariah his son our master John; You gave our lady Mary her son our master Jesus; You protected the daughter of our master Shu'ayb when she encountered our master Moses—peace be upon them all. O Allah, O our Lord! I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad and upon all the prophets and messengers, and to grant him intercession and the highest rank. O Allah! I ask You to forgive my sins, cover all my faults, save me from the Fire, grant me Your pleasure, safety, pardon and kindness, and to bless me in Your Garden together with the prophets, the truthful, the martyrs and the righteous whom You have favored. Truly, You are powerful over all things.

May Allah send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household for as long as the winds drive the gathered clouds and every soul tastes death. O Allah! Convey peace to the people of the Abode of Peace.

O Allah! Employ me in that for which You created me. Do not occupy me with what You have guaranteed for me of provision, filling my heart with it. You have already taken upon Yourself to provide for me, so do not deprive me while I ask You, and do not punish me while I seek Your forgiveness.

O Allah! Employ me in that for which You created me. Do not occupy me with what You have guaranteed for me of provision, filling my heart with it. You have already taken upon Yourself to provide for me, so do not deprive me while I ask You, and do not punish me while I seek Your forgiveness.

O Allah! Employ me in that for which You created me. Do not occupy me with what You have guaranteed for me of provision, filling my heart with it. You have already taken upon Yourself to provide for me, so do not deprive me while I ask You, and do not punish me while I seek Your forgiveness.
O Allah! Send blessings and peace upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! By the honor of Your Beloved Muhammad Mustafa, we turn to You and love You. O our master Muhammad, we seek through you nearness to your Lord. O pure and noble Messenger, intercede for us with the Most Generous.

O Allah! By the rank he has with You, make him an intercessor for us.
O Allah! By the rank he has with You, make him an intercessor for us.
O Allah! By the rank he has with You, make him an intercessor for us.

O Allah! Make us among the best of those who send blessings and peace upon our Prophet, among the nearest to him, and among those who will meet him. Make us among his lovers, and among the dearest of those loved by him. Make us rejoice with him on the Day of Gathering.

Make him for us a guide in the Garden of Bliss, leading us in without toil, hardship or reckoning. Direct him toward us pleased with us while we hope for his intercession, and do not make him displeased with us.
O Allah! Forgive us, our parents, and all Muslims, their dead and their living. Our final prayer is: praise belongs to Allah, Lord of the worlds. (Beginning of the fourth quarter)

I ask You. O Allah! O Allah! O Allah! O Living, O Self-Subsisting! O Possessor of Majesty and Generosity! There is no god but You; glory be to You. I have not fulfilled Your mighty commands and I have been among the wrongdoers.

O Allah! By the right of the Kursi and what it carries of Your magnificence, majesty, might, power and dominion; by Your pure hidden names that none of Your creation knows; and by Your name which, when You place it on the night, it darkens; when You place it on the day, it shines; when You place it on the heavens, they stand without pillars; when You place it on the earth, it is made firm; when You place it on the seas, their waters surge and overflow; when You place it on the springs, their waters gush; and when You place it upon the clouds, they pour down rain—I ask You.

I ask You by the names inscribed upon the forehead of our master Jibril (peace be upon him), and by the names written on the forehead of our master Israfil (peace be upon him), and by the names written on all the angels.
By the names written around the Throne and the Kursi, I ask You.
By Your supreme name with which You have named Your own exalted Essence, I ask You.
By all of Your names, those I know and those I do not know.

O Allah! I ask You by the names with which our master Adam (peace be upon him) called upon You, and by the names with which our master Noah (peace be upon him) called upon You. I ask You by the names with which our master Salih called upon You; by the names with which our master Yunus (peace be upon him) called upon You; by the names with which our master Moses (peace be upon him) called upon You; by the names with which our master Harun (peace be upon him) called upon You; by the names with which our master Shu'ayb (peace be upon him) called upon You; by the names with which our master Abraham (peace be upon him) called upon You; by the names with which our master Ishmael (peace be upon him) called upon You; by the names with which our master David (peace be upon him) called upon You. I ask You by the names with which our master Solomon (peace be upon him) called upon You; by the names with which our master Zachariah (peace be upon him) called upon You; by the names with which our master Joshua (peace be upon him) called upon You; by the names with which our master Khidr (peace be upon him) called upon You; by the names with which our master Elias (peace be upon him) called upon You; by the names with which our master Elisha (peace be upon him) called upon You; by the names with which our master Dhu'l-Kifl (peace be upon him) called upon You. I ask You by the names with which our master Jesus (peace be upon him) called upon You; and by the names with which Your Prophet, Your Messenger, Your Beloved, whom You chose from among mankind—our master Muhammad—called upon You. O You whose word is true, who said: “Allah created you and what you do.” Nothing is uttered or done or any motion or stillness occurs from any of Your servants except as it comes to pass exactly as in Your knowledge, decree and preordainment.

O Allah! O Allah! O Allah! I ask You to grant everyone who follows our Prophet and loves him, on the Day of Reckoning, provision of his intercession and companionship without scrutiny of faults, without punishment, without rebuke or rejection. O Bestower, O Oft-Forgiving, I ask You to forgive my sins and conceal my faults. On the Day when rewards are given without measure, I ask You, among all dear friends, to bless me with gazing upon Your lofty Beauty, to accept my deeds, and to pardon all my mistakes—those I committed knowingly or unknowingly or in error—which You know by Your eternal knowledge. I ask You to grant me my greatest wish: to reach the visit of the grave of our Prophet (peace be upon him) and to greet him and his two companions, by Your bounty, grace, generosity and kindness. O Most Kind, O Most Merciful, O Protecting Friend! On behalf of myself and all the believing men and women and all the Muslim men and women, their families and their living and their offspring, I ask You to reward our master Muhammad with the greatest, most virtuous and most comprehensive reward You grant to any of Your creation. O Mighty, O Noble, O All-Knowing!

O Allah! By the things upon which I swore to the majesty of Your Essence—before the sky was built, the earth spread, the mountains raised, the springs gushed forth, the seas were calmed, the rivers surged, the sun rose, the moon shone, and the stars lit the darkness—I ask You to send a blessing upon our master Muhammad and his household in a manner known only to You.
I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household by the number of Your words.
I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household by the number of the verses and letters of the Qur'an.
I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household by the number of those who recite blessings upon him.
I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household by the number of those who do not recite blessings upon him.
I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household to the fill of the earth.
I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household by the measure of what the Pen wrote in the Preserved Tablet regarding destiny.
I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household by the number of what You created in the seven heavens.
I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household by the measure of what You will create until the Day of Resurrection—each day a thousand times.

I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household, from the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of raindrops falling from the sky to the earth—each day a thousand times.

In the name of Allah, the Most Merciful, the Especially Merciful.

May Allah, the Exalted, send blessings and peace upon our Master Muhammad, his family and his companions.

O Allah! By the rank that Your Prophet, our Master Muhammad (peace be upon him) has with You, by the love You have for him and he has for You, and by the secret between You and him, I ask You to send blessings and peace upon him, his family and his companions.

Increase my love for him many times over. For his sake and his lofty stations, make me truly know him. Grant me success in following his way, living his manners and his sunnah.

Grant me resolve in this. Honor me by allowing me to see the Messenger (peace be upon him). Gladden me by letting me converse with him.

Remove difficulties, barriers, intermediaries and veils. Let my ears partake of his sweet address. Allow me to benefit from the knowledge and gnosis of the Messenger (peace be upon him), O Allah!...

Make my prayers upon him a complete, pure, radiant light that erases every injustice, darkness, doubt, shirk, disbelief, falsehood and sin. Make that salat a cause for my purification.

Through these blessings, raise me to the summit of the station of sincerity, so that no doubt remains in me that any worship is due to any besides You. Thus may I be worthy of Your presence and be joined among Your close friends.

Grant that I do all this while always holding fast to the manners and sunnah of the Messenger (peace be upon him), seeking help from his noble person.

O Allah! O Light! O Truth! O Manifest!

O Allah! O Light! O Truth! O Manifest!

O Allah! O Light! O Truth! O Manifest!

O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of those who glorify and sanctify You and who prostrate to You in reverence, I ask You to send blessings every day a thousand times upon our master Muhammad and his household.
O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of what You create in every year, I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.
O Allah! By the number of the clouds that move, I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of the winds that blow, I ask You to send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! So long as the winds blow and move the branches, leaves, fruits and blossoms of the trees, by the number of what You create between the earth and the sky, from the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, I ask You to send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of the waves of the seas, I ask You to send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of the sands, pebbles, clods of earth and stones that You placed in the east and west of the earth, its mountains, plains and valleys, I ask You to send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! On every side of the earth—its qibla side, east, west, center and mountains—by the number of plants You created: trees, fruits, leaves, crops, and all that these produce and will produce of plants and blessed harvests from the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, I ask You to send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! By the number of the humans, jinn and devils You have created and will create until the Day of Resurrection, I ask You to send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of their bodies, faces and the hairs on their heads, I ask You to send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, in every blink of an eye and by the number of their words and breaths, I ask You to send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of the flights of the jinn and the movements of human beings, I ask You to send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! From the day You created the world until the Day of Resurrection, by the number of the small and large creatures You created in the east and west of the earth that we know—and whose reality only Your exalted Essence truly knows—I ask You to send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! I ask You to send a thousand blessings each day upon our master Muhammad and his household by the number of those who send blessings upon him and those who do not, and even by the number of those who will send blessings upon him until the Day of Resurrection.

O Allah! I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household by the number of the living and the dead, and by the number of the fish, birds, ants, bees and all the small creatures You have created.
O Allah! I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household when night grows dark and when day becomes bright.
O Allah! I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household in this worldly life and in the Hereafter.

O Allah! From his infancy in the cradle, through the time of his maturity and guiding the people, until You take his soul while pleased with him, and then until You resurrect him as an intercessor on the Day of Resurrection, I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! By the number of Your creation, by Your good pleasure, by the weight of Your Throne, and by the number of Your words, I ask You to send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household. O Allah! I ask that You grant our master Muhammad and his household the station of al-Wasila, virtue and high rank, the Kawthar basin, al-Maqam al-Mahmud, and endless exaltation. O Allah! I ask You to strengthen his proof and the evidences of his prophethood, to honor the foundation of Islam, and to raise his rank in this world and the Hereafter. And, O our Exalted Master, I ask You for us: enable us to act by his Sunnah, cause us to die upon his religion, gather us in his community and under his banner, and include us among his companions. O Allah! Make us reach his Kawthar basin; give us to drink its nectar with his cups; let us benefit from the love of our Prophet; accept our repentance; grant us safety and well-being from every open and hidden calamity and trial; have mercy on us; forgive us, all male and female believers, all male and female Muslims, their dead and their living. Praise be to Allah, Lord of the worlds. What an excellent Protector He is. Power and strength belong only to Allah, the Most High, the Mighty.

O Allah! So long as doves coo, and birds and animals circle seeking water; so long as the talismans hung to protect innocent children from devils and jinn are of benefit, turbans are wrapped on heads as a sunnah, and those who advance spiritually day by day through righteous deeds continue to advance—send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! Whenever morning light spreads, the winds blow, living beings walk, night and day follow one another, swords are girded, lances are bound tight, and bodies and souls find health from outward and inward illnesses—send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.
O Allah! As long as the spheres turn, the darkness of night spreads, and the angels glorify You, send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household.

O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household as You sent blessings upon our master Abraham. And bless our master Muhammad and his household as You blessed our master Abraham among all beings. Indeed, You are Praiseworthy, Glorious.

O Allah! So long as the sun rises, the five prayers are performed, lightning flashes, torrential rain pours down, and the angel Ra'd, charged with driving the clouds to where they are commanded, glorifies You—send blessings upon Muhammad and his household.
O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household to the fullness of the earth and the heavens, and the fullness of whatever lies between them and whatever You will besides.

O Allah! Because he bore the burden of the message, saved people from ignorance, strove against the people of disbelief and misguidance, called to recognizing You as the only God, and endured hardship and difficulty while guiding Your servants—grant our master Muhammad whatever he asks, let him attain his desires, and give him in Paradise the station of al-Wasila, virtue and high rank, and the al-Maqam al-Mahmud You promised him. Indeed, You do not break Your promise.

O Allah! Make us among those who follow his path, acting in accordance with the Qur'an and Sunnah; among those characterized by love for him; among those guided by his guidance, words, actions, commands and prohibitions; among those who walk his way. O Most Merciful, resurrect us among the followers of his ummah whose hands, faces and feet shine with the light of ablution, among the foremost of his supporters, among the Ashab al-Yamin praised in the Noble Qur'an, those granted blessings whose records will be given in their right hands and who are saved.

O Allah! Send blessings upon all of Your angels, upon the angels of the near presence, upon the prophets and messengers, and upon all people of worship and obedience. And make us among those who attain Your mercy because of the blessings we send upon them.

O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad, who commands goodness and truth, who will be the intercessor for sinners on the Day of Resurrection, who was chosen as a prophet from Makka al-Mukarrama and sent to all people.

O Allah! Convey on our behalf the most excellent blessings and peace to our Prophet, our intercessor and our beloved. Raise him to the most exalted al-Maqam al-Mahmud. Grant him in Paradise the station of al-Wasila, the virtue and high rank You promised him in the lofty station where all the prophets, messengers, martyrs, siddiqs and righteous are.
O Allah! Send upon him blessings that never diminish and never cease.

O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household for as long as lightning flashes, the sun rises, night spreads its darkness, and raindrops fall from the clouds. O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his household to the fullness of what lies between the earth and sky and between the stars; by the number of the stars of the sky, the raindrops and the pebbles. O Allah! Send upon our master Muhammad and his household blessings whose reward cannot be counted or numbered.
O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad equal to the weight of Your Throne, to the reach of Your good pleasure, to the number of Your words, and to the vastness of Your endless mercy.

O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad, his household, his wives and his descendants. Bless him, his household, his wives and his descendants as You sent blessings and bestowed grace upon our master Abraham and his household. Indeed, You are Praiseworthy, Glorious. O Allah! Reward him on our behalf with the best reward You grant to any prophet of his community. Make us among those guided by the clarity of his rulings; guide us by walking his path; cause us to die as believers in his religion, loving his household, his companions and his lineage; and resurrect us in his company.

O Allah! Send blessings upon the most virtuous of Your prophets, the most generous of those You have chosen from among Your servants, the leader of the saints, the seal of the prophets, the Beloved of the Lord of the worlds, the witness over all the prophets, the intercessor for sinners, the master of the children of Adam, the bearer of glad tidings among the near angels, ever luminous like a shining lamp, truthful and trustworthy, the one who clarifies the truth, gentle and merciful; upon him to whom You granted the Noble Qur'an together with Surah al-Fatiha so he may guide people to the straight path, the Prophet of mercy, the guide of the ummah, the first whose grave will be opened, and the first to enter Paradise; the one supported by our master Jibril and Mika'il; the one given good news in the Torah and Gospel; the one chosen and preferred, Abu'l-Qasim, Muhammad son of Abdullah son of Abdulmuttalib al-Hashimi al-Makki al-Qurashi—peace and blessings be upon him.
O Allah! Send blessings upon the angels who glorify You night and day without fatigue, who do not disobey You in what You command them and who do what they are commanded, and upon all of Your angels.

O Allah! Send blessings upon the angels You have chosen as messengers, made trustees of Your revelation and witnesses over Your creation; to whom You opened the veils of nearness and informed of some of the unseen; from whom You chose guardians of Your Garden and bearers of Your Throne; of whom You made many of Your hosts; whom You favored above the rest of creation; whom You purified of sins and flaws and lodged in Your highest heavens. Send upon them a blessing that increases their virtue and endures, and by the grace of these blessings make us worthy of their seeking forgiveness for us.

O Allah! Send blessings and peace upon all the prophets and messengers whose hearts You expanded with wisdom, whom You crowned with the chain of prophethood, to whom You sent down Your books, by whom You guided creation to tawhid, who called to Your promises of the gardens and their lofty ranks, warned of the punishment of Hellfire, and stood firm by Your proof—so they stood firm upon it. O Allah, send perfect peace upon them, and by the blessing of these prayers grant us the greatest reward.
O Allah! Send upon our master Muhammad and his household a blessing that fulfills his great right over us and is always accepted.

O Allah! Send blessings upon our master Muhammad, possessor of beauty and noble character, graced with the delights of this world and the Hereafter, perfect in his essence and attributes, bearer of the light of messengership and prophethood, lord of the youthful attendants and houris of Paradise, owner of palaces and lofty dwellings, and possessor of a tongue ever grateful. O Allah! Send blessings upon the owner of the grateful heart and abundant knowledge, the one made victorious with his army, honored with pure sons and daughters and noble wives, exalted in the degrees of this world and the Hereafter, ennobled by Zamzam, the Station of Abraham and Muzdalifah, pure of major and minor sins, caretaker of orphans and their nourisher and guardian, teacher of the rites of Hajj, reciter of the Qur'an exactly as it was revealed, glorifier of the All-Merciful, faster of Ramadan, bearer of the Banner of Praise on the Day when all nations gather, possessor of generosity and bounty, faithful to his covenants, loving toward his ummah, calling them with hearts and limbs to what pleases Allah; the one who rode the noble white mule gifted by the king of Alexandria, who mounted the white steed at Khaybar and Hunayn, who used the sword named Qadib, who turned from sins and kept his heart pure, whose words are flawless and upright, whose qualities are described in the heavenly books; the servant of Allah and the seal of His messengers in whom You placed many secrets.
O Allah!
